event.title: was founded by James Brooke in 1862

data.event: Sibu was founded by James Brooke in 1862 when he built a fort in the town to fend off attacks by indigenous Dayak people.
In 1901, Wong Nai Siong led a large scale migration numbering 1,118 Foochow Chinese from Fujian province of China into Sibu.
Lau King Howe Hospital and a number of Methodist schools and churches were built in the 1930s.

event.title: was burnt to the ground twice in 1889

data.event: However, the town of Sibu was burnt to the ground twice in 1889 and in 1928 but it was rebuilt after that.
However, the town of Sibu was burnt to the ground twice in 1889 and in 1928 but it was rebuilt after that.

event.title: the Japanese occupation of Sarawak in 1941

data.event: There was no fierce fighting in Sibu during the Japanese occupation of Sarawak in 1941.

event.title: installed a new Resident at Sibu in June 1942

data.event: The Japanese installed a new Resident at Sibu in June 1942 and Sibu was renamed to "Sibu-shu" in August 1942.
The Japanese installed a new Resident at Sibu in June 1942 and Sibu was renamed to "Sibu-shu" in August 1942.
After the Japanese surrender in 1945, Sarawak was ceded to the British as Crown Colony.
As a result, the second British Governor of Sarawak, Sir Duncan George Stewart was assassinated by Rosli Dhobi when he visited Sibu in December 1949.

event.title: death at Kuching Central Prison in 1950

data.event: Rosli was later hanged to death at Kuching Central Prison in 1950.
Sibu and the Rajang basin also became the centre of communist activities from 1950 and it continued even after the Sarawak independence in 1963.

event.title: continued even after the Sarawak independence in 1963

data.event: Sibu and the Rajang basin also became the centre of communist activities from 1950 and it continued even after the Sarawak independence in 1963.
Communist insurgency in Sarawak was significantly impaired in 1973 and later ended in 1990.
Communist insurgency in Sarawak was significantly impaired in 1973 and later ended in 1990.

event.title: was upgraded to the municipality status in 1981

data.event: Sibu was upgraded to the municipality status in 1981.
The town received a royal visit in September 2001.

event.title: 2011, 110th anniversary of Foochow settlement was celebrated

data.event: In 2011, 110th anniversary of Foochow settlement was celebrated in Sibu.
